title: Formula
text: Keep in mind that the formula to calculate the variance of a binomial distribution is Variance $$=$$ npq, where n $$=$$ The Total # of Trials, p $$=$$ Probability of Success, and q $$=$$ Probability of Failure.

title: Variables
text: What is n (total trials) going to be for this problem? What about p (probability of success)? As it turns out, n $$=$$ 200, p $$=$$ .0156, and q $$=$$ .9844.

title: Answer
text: Knowing our equation for calculating our answer along with our variables, what is our final answer going to be?
